intro: Haplopappus integrifolius subsp. insecticruris, commonly known as the desert hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The subspecies insecticruris is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and geographic distribution compared to other subspecies of Haplopappus.
